COSMOSformat

Class VRealArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • COSMOSformat.VRealArray

  • public class VRealArray
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the fields and methods for real arrays in COSMOS format. It can be used for real headers or real data arrays. It extracts the array information from the text file, provides access to individual values or the whole array, and converts the array values and header into text for writing out to a file. The access to the whole array was added to speed up processing of strong motion records, eliminating the need to copy the data array before using it in processing.

    • Constructor Summary

      VRealArray(VRealArray source)
      Copy constructor - use this to create a copy of a VRealArray object from another VRealArray object.

      • VRealArray

        public VRealArray()
        Default constructor

      • VRealArray

        public VRealArray(VRealArray source)
        Copy constructor - use this to create a copy of a VRealArray object from another VRealArray object. Useful during processing to create a COSMOS component at the next processing step.
        Parameters:
        source - a VRealArray object to be copied

    • Method Detail

      • parseValues

        public int parseValues(int startLine,
                       java.lang.String[] infile)
                throws FormatException
        This method overrides the abstract class to handle the extraction of numeric values for real arrays. It takes a string array of text lines from the input file and an index into the text where the array section begins, and parses the format line, then extracts each number and stores in a real array
        Parameters:
        startLine - beginning line in the text file for the array information
        infile - string array holding the contents of the COSMOS file
        Returns:
        updated line number, now pointing to the line after the array info.
        Throws:
        FormatException - if unable to find the expected format values or unable to convert text to double

      • getRealValue

        public double getRealValue(int index)
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        This getter returns a value from the real array at the given index
        Parameters:
        index - index into the real array
        Returns:
        value from the real array at the index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index not within array index range

      • setRealValue

        public void setRealValue(int index,
                         double value)
                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        This setter sets a value in the real array at the given index to the new value
        Parameters:
        index - index into the real array
        value - value to write into the array at the given index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index not within array index range

      • getRealArray

        public double[] getRealArray()
        This method returns a reference to the real array. This is used when processing V(n) data values to V(n+1) data.
        Returns:
        reference to the real array

      • setRealArray

        public void setRealArray(double[] inArray)
        This method sets the real array reference to the input array. This is used when processing V(n) data values to V(n+1) data.
        Parameters:
        inArray - reference to a real array

      • buildArrayParams

        public void buildArrayParams(VFileConstants.SmArrayStyle packtype)
                      throws FormatException
        This method calculates the values for the valsPerLine, numberFormat, and numLines fields based on the current array size and other field values.
        Parameters:
        packtype - single-column or packed for array output format
        Throws:
        FormatException - if the fieldWidth field is less than or equal to 0

      • arrayToText

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> arrayToText()
        This method takes each numeric value and converts it to its text representation according to the formatting stored for the array. Each text representation of a number is stored in an arrayList
        Returns:
        arrayList of text-formatted numbers

      • getDisplayType

        public java.lang.String getDisplayType()
        Getter for the displayType field,i.e. "F", for floating point
        Returns:
        the display type

      • setDisplayType

        public void setDisplayType(java.lang.String dtype)
        Setter for the displayType field
        Parameters:
        dtype - type to set display type to, i.e. "F" or "E"

      • parseNumberFormatLine

        public void parseNumberFormatLine(java.lang.String line)
                           throws FormatException
        This method takes the format line before either the header or the data arrays and pulls out the needed values such as the number of values in the array, the number of values per line and the field width.
        Parameters:
        line - the line from the text file with array formatting information
        Throws:
        FormatException - if unable to find the necessary values in the line or to convert text to numeric values

      • extractNumericVals

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> extractNumericVals(int startLine,
                                                                java.lang.String[] infile)
                                                         throws FormatException
        This method pulls each string representation of a number out of the line and puts it into a string arrayList. It uses the field width to separate the values in each line and continues until the total value count is reached. Another method handles the text to numeric conversion.
        Parameters:
        startLine - line number in input file contents where array begins
        infile - text file contents in an array of strings
        Returns:
        arrayList of numeric values in text form, one value per entry
        Throws:
        FormatException - if unpacked values from the format line are not valid or if the end-of-file is reached before all values extracted

      • calculateNumLines

        public int calculateNumLines()
                      throws FormatException
        This method uses the number of data values and the number of values per line extracted from the format line to calculate the number of lines of data in the file. Using integer math, round up the count if there's an unfilled last line.
        Returns:
        The number of text file lines holding the values of the array
        Throws:
        FormatException - for an invalid value extracted for values per line

      • numberSectionToText

        public java.lang.String[] numberSectionToText()
        This method converts the array and its format line into text strings to be written to a file. It calls arrayToText, which is defined in each individual array type's methods, to convert each numeric value into a text string according to the output format. This method then packs each text string into a line. It puts the format line at the start and returns a string array ready to be appended to the text output.
        Returns:
        array of strings ready for text file output

      • getFormatLine

        public java.lang.String getFormatLine()
        This getter returns the full format line for the array
        Returns:
        string containing the array's format line

        Parameters:
        formatLine - complete format line for this array

        public java.lang.String getNumberFormat()

        Returns:
        the number format string
